properties.areaDesc: Lawrence, IN; Jackson, IN; Washington, IN
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 3 at 9:40PM EST until January 7 at 4:25AM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...A Flood Warning continues for portions of the following waterways
in Indiana...

East Fork White River...White River...


.Additional precipitation across portions of central and southern
Indiana in the last 24 hours will prolong high water along portions
of the lower White River and East Fork White River by an additional
24 hours or so. Additional rainfall is expected late today
into Saturday, but should be light enough that impacts to river
levels will be minimal.

The Flood Warning continues for
The East Fork White River at Seymour.
* from late tonight to late Monday night.
* At  8:45 PM Friday the stage was 10.7 feet.
* Flood stage is 12.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by late tonight and continue to
rise to near 14.4 feet by Sunday morning.  It will fall below flood
stage by Monday afternoon.
* At 14.0 feet...Pasture lands...agricultural lands and several County
and State Roads begin to flood.  High water isolates a few river
cabins.  State Road 235 east of Medora and county roads near
Shields and Vallonia flood.  Roads that begin to flood include 258
east of Cortland...County Road 725 N just north of the gaging site
and Ewing Road near Brownstown.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
